title: Fisher Tiger Was the Previous User of the Hito Hito no Mi: Model Sun God Nika
author: One Piece Fan Community
theory: This theory proposes that Fisher Tiger was the previous user of the Hito Hito no Mi: Model Sun God Nika devil fruit before Luffy. The evidence includes: (1) Fisher Tiger died approximately 12 years before the current timeline, which is around when Luffy ate his Devil Fruit, suggesting the fruit could have reincarnated; (2) Tiger freed slaves from Mary Geoise just like the legendary Sun God Nika, and his crew was named the 'Sun Pirates' after the sun symbol; (3) Tiger's actions and legacy align with the Nika mythology of liberation and freedom.

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains massive spoilers about Luffy's Devil Fruit revelation from Chapter 1044/Episode 1071

supportingEvidence: Fisher Tiger died 12 years ago, matching the timeline of when Luffy ate the Gomu Gomu no Mi
Tiger's epithet and actions as a liberator of slaves mirrors the Sun God Nika legend
The Sun Pirates crew name could reference Tiger's own power
Tiger's death in episode 543 occurred relatively close in the timeline to Luffy gaining his powers
counterEvidence: No direct confirmation in canon that Tiger had devil fruit powers
Tiger was shown swimming and fighting in water, which devil fruit users cannot do
The Gomu Gomu no Mi/Nika fruit was stated to be in the World Government's possession before Shanks stole it
Timeline doesn't perfectly align - Tiger died when Luffy was 5, but Luffy ate the fruit at age 7
debunkedReason: Timeline inconsistencies and Tiger's ability to swim contradict this theory. Additionally, Chapter 1044 revealed the Nika fruit was in World Government possession until Shanks stole it, with no mention of Tiger.
relatedTheories: Luffy's Devil Fruit is actually the Hito Hito no Mi: Model Nika

title: Koala Will Play a Major Role in Taking Down the World Government
author: One Piece Fan Community
theory: After being freed by Fisher Tiger and witnessing his death (indirectly), Koala will grow up to become a significant force against the World Government. Tiger hoped she could help break the cycle of hatred, and her unique perspective as both a former slave and someone who was shown kindness by fish-men will make her instrumental in the final conflict. This theory gained traction after episode 543 aired.

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains spoilers about Koala's future role in the Revolutionary Army

supportingEvidence: Tiger's dying wish specifically mentioned hope for the next generation, with Koala as the symbol
Koala's unique experience of kindness from fish-men despite being enslaved by humans gives her a unique worldview
The narrative emphasis on Koala in episodes 541-543 suggests future importance
relatedTheories: The Revolutionary Army will be crucial in the final war

title: The Villagers' Betrayal Was Orchestrated by the World Government
author: One Piece Theorists
theory: Some fans theorize that the World Government specifically orchestrated the situation on Foolshout Island to eliminate Fisher Tiger. They suggest the government told the villagers exactly what to do - allow Koala to be returned but then betray Tiger's location - knowing that this would lead to Tiger's death while appearing to be the villagers' choice. This would explain why the Marines were so well-prepared and why Rear Admiral Strawberry was specifically assigned.
supportingEvidence: The Marines arrived very quickly and in force, suggesting pre-planning
The 'deal' offered to the villagers seemed very convenient for the World Government
The World Government had strong motivation to eliminate Tiger after his Mary Geoise raid
counterEvidence: The episode shows the villagers making the decision out of fear, not coercion
No direct evidence of World Government manipulation is shown
The simple explanation of human fear and prejudice is sufficient
relatedTheories: The World Government manipulates events behind the scenes
